intro: Strychnos ramentifera, commonly known as the hairy strychnos, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for various birds and small mammals. Due to its ornamental value and ecological role, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
